abstract: Apple says iPhone sales for fiscal second quarter in greater China surpassed for first time sales in the United States, marked shift in location of company's growth engine; company reports sales in China, Hong Kong and Taiwan of $16.8 billion, rise of 71 percent from quarter year earlier; total revenue is reported as $58 billion, up from $45.6 billion year ago.
lead_paragraph: More than one-quarter of the company’s revenue last quarter came from China, which is becoming an increasingly vital part of Apple’s business.

headline.main: Apple’s Earnings Surge, as iPhone Sales Jump and China Business Rises
headline.print_headline: China Becomes Apple’s Hottest iPhone Market

snippet: More than one-quarter of the company’s revenue last quarter came from China, which is becoming an increasingly vital part of Apple’s business.
